definition: can't wait
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once
(negative prefix)/not/no
and/to reach/up to/in time for

sentences.english: Theres a reason people cant wait for Christmas, and it haslittle to do with family reunions.
sentences.chinese: 人們等不及過聖誕節的理由和家人團聚沒有任何關係。

sentences.english: I can’t wait to buy the first computer jacket. Maybe I’ll never have to go to the office again!
sentences.chinese: 我已經等不及要去買第一件計算機夾克了。

sentences.english: We can't wait to see the episodes start to come to life.
sentences.chinese: 我們等不及要看到完工後的新劇集了。

sentences.english: I can't wait to see his crystal sarcophagus!
sentences.chinese: 我等不及想看到他的水晶棺了。

sentences.english: I can't wait to see what she looks like as Cho .
sentences.chinese: 我都等不及要看她打扮成秋是什麼樣子的了。

sentences.english: The food looks great. I can't wait to try the dip.
sentences.chinese: 這些食物看上去很好喫的樣子，我等不及想嘗一口了。

sentences.english: i'm really impatient to go again and stay for a while
sentences.chinese: 我真的等不及再來次中國並待上一段時間了。

sentences.english: The dinner smelled so good that I couldn’t wait to tuck into it.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐聞起來太美味了，我等不及要大喫一頓了。

sentences.english: I can’t wait to hear the rest of the show.
sentences.chinese: 等不及想要聽其它的部分了。

sentences.english: Can't wait for Star Wars in 3-D?
Sean:I can't wait to become a dream stealer.
sentences.chinese: 我倒是等不及要成爲夢境神偷了。

sentences.english: Anyway, we are arriving at Danshui soon. I can't wait to watch the beautiful sunset.
sentences.chinese: 無論如何，我們快到淡水了，我等不及看美麗的夕陽。

sentences.english: They simply can't wait for the wetlands photo show.
sentences.chinese: 他們簡直等不及那個溼地圖片展了。

sentences.english: The boy can't wait to unwrap his present.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩等不及要打開他的禮物。
等不及地就想頭髮長了。

sentences.english: Rob Schneider, 44, cannot wait around for Avera to start hiring.
sentences.chinese: 羅伯施耐德，44歲，等不及讓阿韋拉可能僱人。

definition: impatient (idiom); in a hurry/itching to get on with it
unable to wait
to be unable to hold back
impatient/eager to/anxious to
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
to be ready
anxious/impatient
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
late
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
there's not enough time (to do sth)/it's too late (to do sth)
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
wait a moment
almost/nearly/almost all
